uk.ac.ebi.mdk.domain.matrix
Class AbstractReactionMatrix<T,M,R>

java.lang.Object
  uk.ac.ebi.mdk.domain.matrix.AbstractReactionMatrix<T,M,R>
Type Parameters:
T - Type of the matrix (Integer,Float,String)
M - The type for the compound names (uses equals() method) this allows to have the metabolites stored as InChIs,InChIKeys,IMolecules etc..
R - The type of the reactions
All Implemented Interfaces:
ReactionMatrix<T,M,R>
Direct Known Subclasses:
StoichiometricMatrixImpl
public abstract class AbstractReactionMatrix<T,M,R>
extends Object
implements ReactionMatrix<T,M,R>

Generic reaction matrix class

Author:
johnmay

AbstractReactionMatrix

protected AbstractReactionMatrix(int n,
                                 int m)
Specifies a new stoichiometric matrix with specified initial capacities, this can be used if the final or expected size of the final matrix is known. Specifying the capacity here reduces resize penalty

Parameters:
n - Initial capacity of molecules
m - Initial capacity of reactions

public void ensure(int n,

Ensures the matrix has the desired capcity to store the specified n (molecules) and m (reactions). If not the the matrix is resized accordingly.

public Set<M> getHighlyConnectedMolecules(int threshold)
Returns a HashSet of molecules that occur more then the provided threshold

Specified by:
getHighlyConnectedMolecules in interface ReactionMatrix<T,M,R>
Parameters:
threshold - The value above which a molecule is considered highly connected (0 returns an empty set)
Returns:
Set of the high connected Molecules

toTextFile

public void toTextFile(FileWriter fw)
                throws IOException
Writes the reaction matrix to a text file that CytoScape can read and build a connection file (for cytoscape) with all edge values set as "rc" and a threshold at -0meaning no highly connected molecules are removed

Parameters:
fw - file writer to write the text file to
Throws:
IOException

toTextFile

public Map<String,M> toTextFile(FileWriter fw,
                                int connectivityThreshhold)
                         throws IOException
Writes the reaction matrix to a text file that CytoScape can read and build a connection file (for cytoscape) with threshold of highly connected molecule specified and all edge values set as "rc"

Parameters:
fw - file writer to write the text file to
connectivityThreshhold - the value at which to consider components highly connected and exempt from the file (-1 = do not remove)
Throws:
IOException

toSIF

public Map<String,M> toSIF(Writer writer,
                           int connectivityThreshhold,
                           List edgeValues,
                           boolean split)
                    throws IOException
Writes the reaction matrix to a text file that CytoScape can read and build a connection file (for Cytoscape) with threshold of highly connected molecule specified and edge values specified If split is true the name of the highly connected molecule is prefixed with a ticker integer and added the returned HashMap.

Parameters:
writer - writer to write the text format too
connectivityThreshhold - the value at which to consider components highly connected and exempt from the file (0 = do not remove)
edgeValues - A list of edge values to use for the reactions this allows you to provide a connection type i.e. directionality. The toStirng method is used to print the value. Providing an empty list invokes default behavior
Throws:
IOException
